admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourteenth Irrigation Project will
            (a) assist the Government's program of further
            upgrading its irrigation systems at relatively low cost; and
            (b) improve drainage and flood protection to increase food
            production and provide incidental benefits. The project
            consists of three construction components: Serang Drainage
            and Flood Protection (61,000 ha), Madium Rehabilitation
            State II (65,000 ha) and the Pemali-Comal (50,000 ha) and
            Pekalen-Sampean (70,000 ha) tertiary systems. Also,
            engineering and design for 105,000 ha new tertiary
            construction and for 20,000 ha main systems improvement in
            these project areas will be completed. The project will
            benefit about 800,000 farm families and will increase food
            production by about 234,000 tons per year. Risks will be
            moderate, as are normal for irrigation, flood protection and
            drainage projects.
